alert.note: Alert for Lake; Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 23 at 3:31PM EST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Kankakee River at Shelby affecting Newton and Lake IN Counties. For the Kankakee River...including Shelby...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a combination of rain, snowmelt, and river ice continues. * WHERE...Kankakee River from Near I-65 and De Motte downstream to IL/IN state line, including the Shelby gauge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Low-lying wetlands, forest land, and agricultural land along the river may flood. Roadways along the river may flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 9.5 feet. River gauge data and river ice spotter reports indicated an ice jam near the Illinois Indiana state line and near Shelby. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain above bankfull and may rise to near flood stage over the next several days. Shifting of river ice may occur which would cause rapid fluctuations in water levels. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. An ice jam is affecting water levels in this area. River forecasts during ice jams are less certain due to many complicated factors. Significant river ice cover can cause large water level fluctuations and flooding with little advanced notice. River ice may also cause gauge observations to be inaccurate. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday morning at 845 AM CST.
